primary_factors: Forecast total of ~11" snow is concentrated Saturday–Sunday, not during the Friday school day
Friday 11/28 conditions: light snow/freezing drizzle with only ~1–2" additional accumulation and good visibility for Michigan standards
Temperatures remain below freezing but winds are modest and no blizzard/ice-storm conditions are expected on Friday
Historical analogs show low closure rates for advisory-level Fridays with the main storm on the weekend
Safety assessment indicates only moderate risk with conditions manageable via normal plow/salt operations; a delay would suffice if anything
decision_rationale:
This prediction is for FRIDAY, NOV 28 in Rockford, Michigan.

Meteorology: Friday itself features light snow/freezing drizzle, around 1–2" of additional snow, temps in the 20s to near 30°F, and generally decent visibility. The 11" total and Winter Storm Watch are tied mainly to the Saturday–Sunday storm, not the Friday school window.

Michigan thresholds: Less than 4" of snow with routine winter conditions corresponds to about a 5–15% closure probability. Friday’s setup falls squarely into that category: no heavy rates, manageable visibility, and road crews well within normal capacity.

Historical patterns: Past events with a weaker Friday system followed by a stronger weekend storm show low closure rates on the advisory-type day, with closures more likely only when the heaviest snow coincides with a weekday morning commute. Here, the main storm peaks on Saturday, so direct school-day disruption is minimal.

Safety: The safety assessment flags moderate risk: slick spots and some compacted snow/ice on side roads and lots, but primary roads remain mostly wet-to-slushy with effective plow/salt response. The expert explicitly notes that conditions do not strongly support a full snow day and that, at most, a short delay could be justified.

Synthesis: Combining these, a full snow day for Friday is unlikely in a Michigan context. To stay calibrated and competitive on Brier score and avoid being overly conservative, I set the probability at 18%, at the high end of the <4" guideline range but still clearly in the "school open" regime.
